timeline.message:
fix: disables pitr-lite tests in emulator

The feature is not supported in the emulator currently.

timeline.bodyText: This query will list the OPTION_VALUE of all databases on the test instance. If this test is executed against an existing instance with multiple databases having a version_retention_period, it could fail.
timeline.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText:
I am wondering how could this happen, since I am using the dbClient for which we need to specify a database to create. Or maybe I am missing something?
That query is also mentioned in the pitr-lite specification on how to get the version_retention_period of a database, but I wonder if we missed something. In the current tests, specifying the schema_name as '' works in our internal tests.
replies.author: thiagotnunes

replies.bodyText: Sorry, you're completely right. I forgot that the INFORMATION_SCHEMA is always database-specific.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.bodyText: nit: The ResultSet is created using a single-use read context and it is fully consumed, so it will be closed, but I would say that it is good practice to always close the ResultSet when you are done with it.
timeline.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText: Good point, added the close call.
replies.author: thiagotnunes

timeline.message:
fix: closes result set in test

Addresses PR comment.
tests: remove IT and add unit

fix: updates DatabaseInfo equals/hashcode

To compare version retention period and earliest version time.

fix: formatting

Fixes formatting of the DatabaseInfo

feature: adds test for throttled pitr field

Adds test to check for the throttled field in the update database ddl
metadata.

timeline.bodyText: nit: Could we have a more elaborate comment on this method? And also for getEarliestVersionTime. I don't think everyone will understand what these fields mean.
timeline.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText: Added more information to both params, let me know if there are satisfactory.
replies.author: thiagotnunes

timeline.message:
fix: explain further the pitr-lite params in docs

Adds more explanations to the purpose of the added params for pitr-lite:
version_retention_period and earliest_version_time.

fix: explain further the pitr-lite params in docs

Adds more explanations to the purpose of the added params for pitr-lite:
version_retention_period and earliest_version_time.

fix: explain further the pitr-lite params in docs

Adds more explanations to the purpose of the added params for pitr-lite:
version_retention_period and earliest_version_time.

feat: adds version time to backups

Adds PITR-lite version time to backups. This should make it possible to
specify the consistent time for copying the database.

feat: adds version time to backups

Adds PITR-lite version time to backups. This should make it possible to
specify the consistent time for copying the database.

timeline.bodyText: nit: Should we consider naming this variable databaseVersionTime to make it clearer that this relates to the version of the database that is being / has been backed up?
timeline.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText:
I am trying to keep the naming one to one with the proto fields. I did try to add some javadoc in the setVersionTime that explains more about the field.
Let me know if this is not clear enough though, and I could make this change.
replies.author: thiagotnunes

replies.bodyText:
I am trying to keep the naming one to one with the proto fields.

That is reasonable and also makes it easier for users to search for documentation online.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.bodyText: nit: Wouldn't it be better to make the builder accept null values instead of having to wrap these calls in if-statements every time it is set?
timeline.author: olavloite

timeline.message: chore: refactors / addresses pr comments

Exposes earliest version time and version retention period fields in the
database class.

Adds integration tests for updating the version retention period.

Adds create database tests for PITR and refactors the integration test
class.

Separates PITR database tests into 2 files for clarity.

The feature is not supported in the emulator currently.

To compare version retention period and earliest version time.

metadata.

fix: explain further the pitr-lite params in docs

version_retention_period and earliest_version_time.

Adds PITR-lite version time to backups. This should make it possible to
specify the consistent time for copying the database.
